content.full_text:
DATA MANAGEMENT PLAN
1. Describe the datatypes (surveys, sequences, manuscripts, objects, the research will 
collect and/or generate and /or (re)use.
chemical compound characterisation (LC-MS data, NMR data, software specific data types)
quantitative cell binding (gamma counting, csv format data)
quantitiative tissue binding (autoradiography, TIFF data)
Biodistribution data (gamma counter CSV format data)
Dynamic biodistribution data (preclinical) (microPET camera, software specific)
Dynamic biodistribution data (clinical) (PET/CT camera, software specific)
2. Specify in which way the following provisions are in place in order to preserve the data 
during and at least 5 years after the end of the research.
3. What's the reason why you wish to deviate from the principle of preservation of data 
and of the minimum preservation term of 5 years?
not applicable
4. Are there issues concerning research data indicated in the ethics questionnaire of this 
application form? If yes, which specific security measures those data require?
Depending on the results, IP may be secured on data generated by this research project so that data 
will not be made public after the time period required to protect IP.
Data from clinical studies on patients are stored on the secure network of UZ Leuven to protect 
privacy.
5. Which other issues related to the data management are relevant to mention?
None
To FWO? if yes, please provide the project number(s),title and programme.
Yes, FWO,PhD grant application Romy Cools 1SB9322N
Has the proposal already been funded?
Funding decision still pending
To another organization? If yes, please provide the name of that organization. 
NoPROJECT
OTHER FUNDING
Have the content of this proposal and at least the main part of the proposed research 
actions,be it with literally the same text or in a varied form, already been submitted 
before AND was it funded or is the funding decision still pending (applications that 
finally did not result in funding should not be mentioned)?
Yes
- 11 -Applicant: Guy Bormans | Application number:
